interface.name: desktop_shell
interface.description: Traditional user interfaces can rely on this interface to define the foundations of typical desktops. Currently it's possible to set up background, panels and locking surfaces.

request.name: set_grab_surface
request.description: The surface set by this request will receive a fake pointer.enter event during grabs at position 0, 0 and is expected to set an appropriate cursor image as described by the grab_cursor event sent just before the enter event.

event.name: prepare_lock_surface

description.summary: tell the client to create, set the lock surface

event.description: Tell the shell we want it to create and set the lock surface, which is a GUI asking the user to unlock the screen. The lock surface is announced with 'set_lock_surface'. Whether or not the shell actually implements locking, it MUST send 'unlock' request to let the normal desktop resume.

event.name: grab_cursor

description.summary: tell client what cursor to show during a grab

event.description: This event will be sent immediately before a fake enter event on the grab surface.

interface.name: surface_data
interface.description: The shell can use this interface to receive surface information or make requests for this surface.

request.name: destroy
request.description: The shell must send this request in response to a gone event so the compositor can destroy the object properly.

description.summary: send the surface object output_mask to the shell
send the surface object title to the shell

event.name: gone
event.description: The compositor should send this event to notify the shell that a surface has been destroyed. The client must respond with a destroy request.

interface.name: surface_data_manager
interface.description: The compositor can offer surface data to a shell. The client can use this interface as a way to receive special surface_data objects.

event.name: surface_object
event.description: Surface object sent to a shell. This object is intended to allow the shell to initiate a surface_data object interface.

interface.name: screensaver
interface.description: Only one client can bind this interface at a time.

request.name: set_surface

description.summary: set the surface type as a screensaver

request.description: A screensaver surface is normally hidden, and only visible after an idle timeout.
